page.title: 16 ADULT ACTIVITIES
page.content: The Women's Institute meets once a month at the Village Hall Felindre with guest speakers,competitions and various social activities,the emphasis being on crafts,cookery and sport.On two evenings in November they hold a variety concert with husbands and children olso taking part.During the summer they organise a picnic outing for members and children. The Mothers's Union meets once a month at the vicarage with the vicar's wife chairing the meetings. Beguildy School is used for school concerts, P.T.A. dances, quizzes, whist drives for adults and children and it is also used as a church hall for most church functions. The two local public houses are also meeting places for social gatherings both having darts, dominoes and pool teams which play in the local leagues.
